text: hi everyone anthony fantano here
internet's busiest music nerd
and we're gonna do a quick review here
of the new church's album the bones of
what you believe these guys are a
scottish synth pop outfit who i told a
lot of you in the comments maybe i
wasn't so crazy about their new lp i
wasn't really planning to review their
lp but as a lot of you know i put out a
video talking about
the sexual harassment sort of the
misogyny that's been thrown the band's
way via facebook and other social media
platforms and how
lead singer lauren mayberry was speaking
out about that and i felt bad not really
talking about the band's musical talents
and really sort of having the
only mention of their new album on this
channel be that video because clearly
churches has more to bring the world
than a view on misogyny and sexual
harassment so in a nutshell churches
essentially makes synthesizer pop with a
bit of an 80s chic but with a very
strong modern indie pop vibe as well on
top of that i would actually say that
the trio has a very
bright and accessible commercial edge to
their songs too but overall this is just
an album where outright i just ended up
preferring the singles and pretty much
that's it really i wasn't as crazy about
the deeper cuts i love songs on here
like mother we share i love recover and
the song night sky is a really catchy
standout for me on here as well to go
back to the song recover the
synthesizers that open that track as
well as the verses with the really odd
vocal phrasing it's all really ear
catching and then when the chorus comes
up it's such a melodically sweet chorus
the vocal melody on this hook is stellar
and it's such a long hook too
it lasts a really long time i actually
think the chorus lasts longer than the
verses
on this track
i actually think this song the majority
of the time is this elongated chorus but
i don't find every chorus on this lp to
be well written and succinct for example
the song we sink i'll be a thorn in your
side till you die i'll be a thorn in
your side for all ways if we sink we'll
lift our love i just don't see what's so
appealing about this hook for a band
that makes pop music they have some
incredibly uncatchy songs on this album
and then there are moments where i feel
like churches try to take it away from
their very bright obvious catchy side
and do something a little sweeter a
little more toned down like on the song
tether but it just ends up feeling
boring because
not only does the band's instrumentation
not really play all too well in a more
subtle direction but lauren mayberry's
voice doesn't really strike me as at
least on this song an incredibly emotive
vocal while her ultra youthful singing
sounds fantastic on these really bright
upbeat catchy songs to do something a
little more tender the dynamics they're
for me just not there but i prefer
lauren's vocals on any of these tracks
to the male vocals that pop in on the
song under the tide as well as the
closer here too
neither of which are
appealing to me
i just think the male vocals on this lp
are flat bland and not interesting at
all while i don't think lauren is an
incredibly passionate vocalist on this
record her singing on these songs is at
least sweet i think my one surprise with
lauren's singing was on the song science
slash visions where not only does her
accent peek through a little bit on this
song but i feel on the chorus on this
track she slips out of that girlish tone
into something that feels a little more
mature has a bit more body and this
instrumental here i think is a little
surprising for
churches as well while it's just as busy
as a lot of the other beats on this lp
it's really a dark instrumental and over
the course of the song it just grows
more and more intense and not to count
out the other instrumentals either like
by the throat that while they are sweet
with all these sparkling synth arpeggios
there's quite a bit of detail in the
beat and then there is lungs on here
which is a very off-kilter groove on
this instrumental with these very bassy
distorted heavy synth notes that play
through a majority of the song overall i
did think this album was likable but
it's not anything that i enjoyed from
front to back a lot of potholes on this
thing to be completely honest and
overall i think that while churches can
write some really catchy songs they do
have a very sweet appeal their
production is very bright and ear
grabbing there are moments where i feel
a little let down by the lack of
dynamics and the singing by the
somewhat unmemorable and and kind of
corny lyrics here and there obviously
the male vocals on this lp didn't appeal
to me at all and the slower softer
moments that this album tried to deliver
were nowhere near as entertaining or as
moving as the brighter more hyped up
spots but if you've given this album a
listen what did you think of it did you
love it hate it why what do you think i
should review next and that's it
anthony fantano
churches
forever
